name: 3-chloropropionitrile
Reason: 3-chloropropionitrile has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit, propionitrile, has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The chlorine atom introduces a strong withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 3-chloropropionitrile will affect its melting point: (1) The methyl group introduces a bulky side chain, reducing the crystal lattice stability, which might decrease the melting point by approximately -10°C. (2) The chlorine atom raises the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the formation of hydrogen bonds, estimated at approximately +50°C. Summing up these modifications gives us an estimated melting point shift.
